title: How to Boot a Mac or MacBook Into Safe Mode

steps.title: Click the Apple menu .
steps.content: Click the Apple menu . This will be in the top-left corner. A drop-down menu will open. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click About This Mac.
steps.content: Click About This Mac . A new window will open.

steps.title: Locate your Mac type.
steps.content: Locate your Mac type. Check the information underneath your Mac version. If you see an item labeled Chip , you have a Mac with Apple silicon. If you see an item labeled Processor , you have an Intel-based Mac.

steps.title: Turn off your Mac.
steps.content: Turn off your Mac. Select the Apple menu and click Shut Down . If absolutely necessary, you can force shut down a frozen Mac by holding down the Power button. You'll need to wait for your Mac to completely shut down. The screen should be black, and all lights should be off.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button. When you see the Loading startup options screen, you can let go.

steps.title: Select a startup disk.
steps.content: Select a startup disk. In most cases, this will be Macintosh HD .

steps.title: Hold ⇧ Shift and click Continue in Safe Mode.
steps.content: Hold ⇧ Shift and click Continue in Safe Mode . When you select this option, your Mac will restart automatically. You should see Safe Boot in the menu bar on the login window. You are now in Safe Mode. To exit Safe Mode, you'll just need to restart your Mac.

steps.title: Restart your Mac
steps.content: Restart your Mac . Select the Apple menu and click Restart . If it's off, use the Power button to turn it on. Similar to starting Safe Mode in Windows , you'll need to hold on a button.

steps.title: Immediately press and hold ⇧ Shift.
steps.content: Immediately press and hold ⇧ Shift . After a few moments, you should see the login window.

steps.title: Log in to your Mac.
steps.content: Log in to your Mac. Enter your password to log into your account. You may be asked to log in twice. If you didn't see Safe Boot in the menu bar in the previous step, you should see it now. Your Mac is now in Safe Mode. You can now run any diagnostics safely. To exit Safe Mode, restart your Mac.
